instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115-b
threads.message:
hi guys, 
                      received the board with c7800 short to ground , removed it and replaced with a good one and it worked fine for few hours the it goes bad again , this has happened few times , can you suggest what can that be ? i will update about the voltages on it later.
thanks

threads.title: 820-3115-b
threads.message: How can it short to GND there is no GND connection on C7800.

threads.title: 820-3115-b
threads.message: hi , thanks for the response , i have just checked the schema , you are absolutely right , there is no ground to it , it is connected to the resisitors and q7800 , actually every time it stops working the c7800 shows continuity like a fuse as it was a caps so i didn't bother and thought it was getting short to ground and replacing it makes it work for a little while . i did not check the resistor values around it . what do you suggest , is it happening because of faulty q7800 ,i will appreciate your advice ,  thanks

threads.title: 820-3115-b
threads.message: Could be a bad Q7800 yeah.
